title: "Everything in LoR—from the art to the flavor text—is canon"
body:
https://assets-prd.ignimgs.com/2019/10/16/legends-of-runeterra-ign-092-1571190267767.jpg

Okay.

I, for one, welcome our new Cat overlords.

https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2019/11/ask-riot-riot-games/

replies.body:
This was really weird to read... how can all this stuff be considered canon?
So Heimerdinger **is** secretly building a gigantic T-Hex somewhere in Piltover? For real?

> [{quoted}](name=Chembaron Yamada,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-11-08T14:22:26.831+0000)
>
> This was really weird to read... how can all this stuff be considered canon?
> So Heimerdinger **is** secretly building a gigantic T-Hex somewhere in Piltover? For real?

That quote is a bit misleading out of context. As MELELL elaborated in her full answer, everything in Legends of Runeterra, from the art fo the flavor text, is _canonically grounded _- these are how these characters WOULD react and MIGHT speak if they canonically encountered each other, if these events transpired, etc. Not to speak for Mel or LoR, but the example MELELL gave in her answer I think is a great one: 

Lux has not witnessed a Progress Day in any established stories. But in the card game, her card interacts well with the spell, "Progress Day!" So she has a line of dialog that triggers when she witnesses the Progress Day.

Similarly, Garen and Katarina in LoR have a few lines that puts the wind in the sails of certain ships (ahem), but they have yet to meet in a story moment.

The complexity and nuance here revolves around what we mean by canon. Mel's quote (out of context) speaks to how everything in LoR is grounded in established Runeterran events, and that LoR will have the opportunity to be our first looks at parts of the world we haven't seen - but it doesn't mean every single unit, character, or event is a point on the timeline of Runeterra, verbatim. (Heimerdinger hasn't built a T-Hex... yet. :P)

Hope that helps!

(And all that said, all hail our new Cataclysm overlords.)

Soooo, basically all this stuff is the same like the ingame quotes from champions towards each other? That this would happen **if** the opportunity arises, but not every champion interacting with each other in the game have met in the lore yet?

> [{quoted}](name=Chembaron Yamada,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=000000040000,timestamp=2019-11-08T22:25:08.603+0000)
>
> Soooo, basically all this stuff is the same like the ingame quotes from champions towards each other? That this would happen **if** the opportunity arises, but not every champion interacting with each other in the game have met in the lore yet?

That's a great comparison! :)
.......Just a bit of let down. I can understand not every single thing can be canon. But that mean's even those noxian kids from the noxian deck might not even exists?...meh

I am a bit glad, tho. They ridiculed Zaun and Piltover a bit with these cards, like the Yordle chembarons in a trenchcoat, the T-Hex, the Cataclysm.... And now I got a grey zone to tell myself "these **could** be canon some day, when weird coincidences meet, but they are not right now." Good riddance.

> [{quoted}](name=Chembaron Yamada,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=00000004000000010000,timestamp=2019-11-09T20:37:54.886+0000)
>
> I am a bit glad, tho. They ridiculed Zaun and Piltover a bit with these cards, like the Yordle chembarons in a trenchcoat, the T-Hex, the Cataclysm.... And now I got a grey zone to tell myself "these **could** be canon some day, when weird coincidences meet, but they are not right now. Good riddance.

"They ridiculed Zaun and Piltover a bit with these cards"

Yeah! How DARE Riot to put those ridicule creatures in my super serious faction. Its obvious that if Mr Rat man, Goo superhero and Purple Doctor are the pinnacle of seriousness.

Granted, Dr. Mundo is a walking meme basically, right. Don't know what they are doing to him after his VGU, we will see. But Twitch and Zac I can still take serious to some extend. While Twitch might come off as silly, he is still a mutated rat using poisons and diseases to end humanity.

While it has some comedic effect that Twitch is smelling and everything, his story is still pretty serious... he has melted the eyes of a victim with acid, god dammit.
Zac is the same, he can have lighthearted parts, but his story in general is still not just a meme. He was an experiment, meant to kill, but his parents saved him and paid with their lives for that, now he tries to uphold their moral standards by saving people in Zaun.

I can't compare these with a suit called Cataclysm or a gigantic hextech T-Rex..... These are just straight memes for me.

> [{quoted}](name=Chembaron Yamada,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=0000000400000001000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-09T21:15:41.099+0000)
>
> Granted, Dr. Mundo is a walking meme basically, right. Don't know what they are doing to him after his VGU, we will see. But Twitch and Zac I can still take serious to some extend. While Twitch might come off as silly, he is still a mutated rat using poisons and diseases to end humanity.
> 
> While it has some comedic effect that Twitch is smelling and everything, his story is still pretty serious... he has melted the eyes of a victim with acid, god dammit.
> Zac is the same, he can have lighthearted parts, but his story in general is still not just a meme. He was an experiment, meant to kill, but his parents saved him and paid with their lives for that, now he tries to uphold their moral standards by saving people in Zaun.
> 
> I can't compare these with a suit called Cataclysm or a gigantic hextech T-Rex..... These are just straight memes for me.

Saying that Twitch is serious because he is deathly is comparable to saying that Cataclysm is serious because HE is deathly. Von Yipp just wanted to give a new body to his beloved one, that is actually similar to the lore of Oriana. But nooo, the lore of Oriana is okay and Cataclysm is not just because one is a woman and the other is a cat. Rumble building a mech using literal trash is okay, but is not when Heimerdinger does it using a whole team helping him.

Anything can be serious or silly with the correct backstory.

Guess we can agree on that. Personally, I see the Cataclysm and T-Hex just as jokes and prefer to take them as non-canon, that's all. I never said you can't think otherwise, that's why I said I am glad that this statement gave me a grey area.

Who prefers these to be canon can consider them as such, I have chosen not to.

The Yordle one might not be entirely too far fetched when something like mundo is there too. But it kinda sucks knowing that LoR in it's entirety may not even be canon. Maybe just another card game. I mean hearthstone takes direct references and is said to be canon.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Pls,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=00000004,timestamp=2019-11-08T22:18:38.531+0000)
>
> The complexity and nuance here revolves around what we mean by canon. Mel's quote (out of context) speaks to how everything in LoR is grounded in established Runeterran events, and that LoR will have the opportunity to be our first looks at parts of the world we haven't seen - but it doesn't mean every single unit, character, or event is a point on the timeline of Runeterra, verbatim. (Heimerdinger hasn't built a T-Hex... yet. :P)

This also explains why there's a character (I forget her name) that has like 3-4 different cards of her, but each of them feature different points in her timeline.

> [{quoted}](name=Autrah Fang,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=000000040002,timestamp=2019-11-09T06:59:59.114+0000)
>
> This also explains why there's a character (I forget her name) that has like 3-4 different cards of her, but each of them feature different points in her timeline.

Yep! LoR has an opportunity to show many different points in the Runeterran timeline. That lets them have cards of characters that are dead or in a different state (pre lantern Senna, pre murdered by Yasuo Yone, Ledros, Vrynna, etc) as well as introduce characters who could exist in the world or may exist in the world at some future point. 

LoR VO content also serves double duty of getting to give flavorful bits AND support gameplay by hinting at and calling out gameplay synergies (hello, Lux and Progress Day). 

Do two characters talk bc they work well together in the deck, or bc they have a history in world? Ideally both! It will be exciting to see how LoR lore (heh) grows in expressions, especially as more players get to play and share their impressions on what excites them about their those expressions!
So you are saying that it is totally possible to get a future trunk kind of card that is the spawn of {{champion:86}} x{{champion:55}} .

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Pls,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=00000004,timestamp=2019-11-08T22:18:38.531+0000)
>
> That quote is a bit misleading out of context. As MELELL elaborated in her full answer, everything in Legends of Runeterra, from the art fo the flavor text, is _canonically grounded _- these are how these characters WOULD react and MIGHT speak if they canonically encountered each other, if these events transpired, etc. Not to speak for Mel or LoR, but the example MELELL gave in her answer I think is a great one: 
> 
> Lux has not witnessed a Progress Day in any established stories. But in the card game, her card interacts well with the spell, "Progress Day!" So she has a line of dialog that triggers when she witnesses the Progress Day.
> 
> Similarly, Garen and Katarina in LoR have a few lines that puts the wind in the sails of certain ships (ahem), but they have yet to meet in a story moment.
> 
> The complexity and nuance here revolves around what we mean by canon. Mel's quote (out of context) speaks to how everything in LoR is grounded in established Runeterran events, and that LoR will have the opportunity to be our first looks at parts of the world we haven't seen - but it doesn't mean every single unit, character, or event is a point on the timeline of Runeterra, verbatim. (Heimerdinger hasn't built a T-Hex... yet. :P)
> 
> Hope that helps!
> 
> (And all that said, all hail our new Cataclysm overlords.)

So if I read this right, it is canon in a sense that it is a realistic possible future, which would mean that it hasn't happened yet, but it being canon, it will happen some day.

> [{quoted}](name=Eternal Torment,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=000000040003,timestamp=2019-11-09T20:08:59.297+0000)
>
> So if I read this right, it is canon in a sense that it is a realistic possible future, which would mean that it hasn't happened yet, but it being canon, it will happen some day.

bad thing happen in the future too, being canon doesn't mean it's a good thing. 
Some of their designs are just not good , reflecting bad views. Garen, the vanguard leader of his country, the honorable warrior, loves a killer a vicious treachery person ,instead of loving the kind and the honest person - that's is the worst design I've ever seen.

At least you finally acknowledge that Garen x Katarina is a canon thing.
{{sticker:sg-ahri-2}}

> [{quoted}](name=Chembaron Yamada,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=00000004000300000000,timestamp=2019-11-09T21:18:06.360+0000)
>
> At least you finally acknowledge that Garen x Katarina is a canon thing.
> {{sticker:sg-ahri-2}}

Canon doesn't mean good. It only reflect the fact that rioters have bad taste in designing characters. I said this long time ago in my post that rioters don't wanna admit the fact that taric is more like garen's woman, because he is the shield and garen is the sword, they are the opposite in personality, while katarina is a killer assasin, vicious and treachery, garen and katarina are both martial art hero and they are competitive like bros, not  like a coulple. All these above, rioters can not give a good answer. They just force their personal ships on everybody like a tyrant.

Because all of this literally does not matter. Like, at all.

Because guess what, people are not chosing their partner simply to compliment each other. That Taric is the shield and Garen is the sword while Katarina uses daggers **doesn't mean anything**.
I already explained this in the past to you, simply because I as a guy prefer to use firearms does not mean I have to chose a partner who has a weapon choice complimenting my fighting style. 

It is not bad design just because you personally prefer another ship. Katarina and Garen are a story of star crossed lovers (like many interactions already point out). The charme of their story comes from the fact that they are on opposing sides of a war. They would definitely love each other and be a couple if they wouldn't have been born in 2 opposing factions, that's the tragedy behind it. They could be a happy couple if Katarina would have been Demacian or Garen has been Noxian. But their path will be way harder and many people would like to see how this all will get solved in the end.

So to clarify, everything in LoR has the _potential_ to be canon, it's just a case of when and how, right?

Some of which is already proper canon, like Ledros, Tianna, Cithria, Progress Day, the Ruination, the champions etc.

To be fair, this is a game that has a stuffed bear destroying people, a kid building a time machine, magical cyborgs, eldritch horrors made from ancient egyptians that can sometimes be friendly parasites, a man who lives simultaneously in the future and the past, a fish yordle who somehow survives all the leviathans of bilgewater and the black mist yearly, a superhero science experiment blobman, and a yordle who somehow claimed a huge part of Noxus' outskirts when its a nation that prides itself on expansion and survival of the fittest.

There is a lot of absurd stuff in the game as is and that's just what I could think of skimming the champion list lol

I mean that's essentially what the Hextech skins are. If you read the lore for those skins, it's all set in Piltover. They are magically alive mechanical creations. Hextech Galio is actually a giant golem. Ignoring the Galio part, that's essentially what Heimer would be doing.

Reading this, first thing that comes to mind (after Cataclysm of course omg) is how the yeti race in Legends of Runeterra was probably designed after the old Willump, because the yeti in this game look nothing like his post-VGU design.

That's one inconsistency that kinda bothers me, but mainly because I love Willump's modern design much more over the traditional "snowy gorilla" yeti. :D

So the yetis in the lore are a super intelligent race that helped Lissandra build the true ice pillars that keep the Watchers in the abyss. However, after the work was done it seems their race was all but wiped out in the huge war that followed. The remaining yetis have gone feral because they are so used to being hunted, which is the state that Willump was in when Nunu first found him. However, the world rune that Willump was guarding has the power to bring imagination to life and when he decided that Nunu was worthy to use it, Willump transformed into the 6 armed whimsical being that Nunu imagined him to be.

So yeah, normal yetis outside of Nunu's mind's eye are more similar to yetis in the traditional sense that we think of them.

> [{quoted}](name=Naalith,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=00020002,timestamp=2019-11-08T19:16:32.328+0000)

So that's Inspiration rune then. The only one missing in Ryze's cinematic with the power to change the rules.
Makes perfect sense to claim that thoee two stories talk about the same rune.

> [{quoted}](name=DwarvenGiant,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=YvXcA11B,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-11-08T16:02:19.847+0000)

If you read Nunu & Willumps bio, you'll find that most people see the yetis as monsters, and that Willumps appearance changed in response to Nunu NOT seeing him that way.
Indeed, they are shapeshifters in that way.
Kinda like Yordles change how they're seen based on people too....

Good point. Yetis are furry, just like yordles and now this point.
Both are most likely spirits.

Maybe Yetis and Yordles are close relatives?

To be fair, as far as I know, Yeti are described in the form as shape shifters? While everyone else saw a terrifying beast, Nunu just saw that friendly giant and that's why he looks that way. It kinda depends on how you are perceiving them.

So basically, if people see them as these creatures like old Willump, then they will look like this. For Nunu, they will look different.
Hah! Take that Necrit!
So you're telling me that its entirely possible that there is actually a giant centipede centaur out there somewhere?
